item.title: A bill to prohibit the Internal Revenue Service from using private debt collection companies, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

item.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E199)
Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

summary.text: Taxpayer Abuse and Harassment Prevention Act of 2007 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to repeal the authority of the Secretary of the Treasury to enter into contracts with private collection agencies to collect unpaid taxes.

bill.title: Taxpayer Abuse and Harassment Prevention Act of 2007

item.title: Taxpayer Abuse and Harassment Prevention Act of 2007
Taxpayer Abuse and Harassment Prevention Act of 2007
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal the authority of the Secretary of the Treasury to enter into private tax collection contracts.

latestAction.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E199)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
